intro: Uncaria lanosa var. parviflora, commonly known as the hairy cat's claw, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its hairy stems and small, white, five-petaled flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that contain the seeds. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is often found in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and traditional medicine.
